pullRequest.title: Fix createJavadoc failing issue
pullRequest.bodyText:
Purpose

Fix the Javadoc creation failing check when tested using ./gradlew :ballerina-lang:createJavadoc ./gradlew :ballerina-parser:createJavadoc or build without skipping the checks using ./gradlew build -x test -x :composer-library:npmInstall -x :composer-library:npmBuild

Fixes #24631
Approach

Change the access modifier of enum Action to public at line: 
  
    
      ballerina-lang/compiler/ballerina-parser/src/main/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/internal/parser/AbstractParserErrorHandler.java
    
    
         Line 481
      in
      13709b8
    
    
    
    

        
          
           enum Action { 
        
    
  


Add return types of Project interface at lines:

  
    
      ballerina-lang/compiler/ballerina-lang/src/main/java/org/ballerinalang/project/Project.java
    
    
         Line 38
      in
      13709b8
    
    
    
    

        
          
                * @return 
        
    
  


and

  
    
      ballerina-lang/compiler/ballerina-lang/src/main/java/org/ballerinalang/project/Project.java
    
    
         Line 46
      in
      13709b8
    
    
    
    

        
          
                * @return 
        
    
  



Samples
Remarks
Check List

 Read the Contributing Guide
 Updated Change Log
 Checked Tooling Support (#)
 Added necessary tests

 Unit Tests
 Spec Conformance Tests
 Integration Tests
 Ballerina By Example Tests


 Increased Test Coverage
 Added necessary documentation

 API documentation
 Module documentation in Module.md files
 Ballerina By Examples

nodes.bodyText:
In java doc comments the @returns specify what it returns not the type of return value, the type of the return value is alredy in the function signature.
In this instance it's something like module exists in the project
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -35,15 +35,15 @@
      * Returns true if the module exists in the project.
      *
      * @param moduleId Module Id
-     * @return
+     * @return boolean

nodes.bodyText: This doesn't looks like a cause for java doc issue. Do you have the log for this?
